sen.j: 源惟良（げん いりょう、男性、生卒年不詳）は、江戸時代中期の日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Iryo GEN (male, year of birth and death unknown) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the mid-Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「生卒年不詳」は「生没年不詳」と解釈して訳しました。
sen.e: Iryo GEN (male, years of birth and death unknown) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the mid-Edo period.
Iryo GEN (male, years of birth and death unknown) was a tenkokuka (artist of seal engraving) in the mid-Edo period.

sen.j: 字は顕哉、号 (称号)に東壑・泐石。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) was Kenya and second name or alias was Togaku and Rokuseki.
sen.cmt: 「顕哉」「東壑・泐石」は読み方不明。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) was Kenya and his pseudonyms were Togaku and Rokuseki.
sen.cmt: 号をpseudonymとしました。複数化しました。
sen.e: His azana (adult male's nickname) was Kenya and his pseudonyms were Togaku and Rokuseki.
His common name was Reizo MORI.
His popular name was Reizo MORI.
sen.cmt: 通称の表現変更しました。
sen.e: His popular name was Reizo MORI.
He temporarily used the family name of Ito.
He temporarily used the family name of Ito.
He temporarily used the family name of Ito.
He was from Kyoto.
He was from Kyoto.
He was from Kyoto.
Brief biography
Brief biography
Brief biography

sen.j: 学問を好み、文章が巧かった。
sen.e: He loved to study and was good at writing.
He loved to study and was good at writing.
He loved to study and was good at writing.

sen.j: また篆刻を嗜むうちに高芙蓉門下となりついに奥義を極め、その高弟となる。
sen.e: While he enjoyed seal engraving, he began to learn under Fuyo KO, mastered the heart of philosophy and became high-caliber disciple.
While he enjoyed seal engraving, he began to learn under Fuyo KO, and finally went to the heart of it, then became a high-caliber disciple.
sen.cmt: finally追加、andの繰り返しの回避、冠詞追加しました。
sen.e: While he enjoyed seal engraving, he began to learn under Fuyo KO, and finally went to the heart of it, then became a high-caliber disciple.

sen.j: 芙蓉が没すると芙蓉の収蔵していた古銅印を集めた『芙蓉山房私印譜』百部を作り、関係者に配布した。
sen.e: When Fuyo died, he collected the kodoin (a kind of seal) which Fuyo possessed, made one hundred copies of "Fuyo Sanbo Shiinpu" and distributed them to the related parties.
When Fuyo died, he collected the kodoin (a kind of seal) which Fuyo possessed, and made a hundred copies of "Fuyo Sanbo Shiinpu" to distribute them to related parties.
sen.cmt: 文の接続を整え、冠詞削除しました。
sen.e: When Fuyo died, he collected the kodoin (a kind of seal) which Fuyo possessed, and made a hundred copies of "Fuyo Sanbo Shiinpu" to distribute them to related parties.

sen.j: また芙蓉十三回忌には余延年とともに全国の芙蓉門下に呼びかけて68人の名家の印を集め『高芙蓉追善印譜』を制作した。
sen.e: Also, at the time of the twelfth anniversary of Fuyo's death, he and Ennen YO asked the disciples of Fuyo across the nation, collected the seals of famous families of 68 persons and made "Kofuyo Tsuizen Inpu."

Also, at the time of the thirteenth anniversary of Fuyo's death, he and Ennen YO asked the disciples of Fuyo across the nation to collect the seals of famous families and made "Kofuyo Tsuizen Inpu" with the 68 seals.
sen.cmt: 文の接続を変更、数字ミス訂正しました。
sen.e: Also, at the time of the thirteenth anniversary of Fuyo's death, he and Ennen YO asked the disciples of Fuyo across the nation to collect the seals of famous families and made "Kofuyo Tsuizen Inpu" with the 68 seals.
He was a heavy-drinker.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was a heavy drinker.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました。
sen.e: He was a heavy drinker.

sen.j: 夜に過って河に転落し自身ではそれに気が付かなかったが翌朝目覚めると松の枝に引っかかって助かっていたという逸話がある。
sen.e: There was an episode that he accidentally fell in a river without realizing it, and when he woke up next morning he was hanging on a pine tree branch.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is an episode that he accidentally fell in a river without realizing it, and when he woke up in the next morning, he was hanging on a pine tree branch.
sen.cmt: 現在形化、前置詞挿入しました。
sen.e: There is an episode that he accidentally fell in a river without realizing it, and when he woke up in the next morning, he was hanging on a pine tree branch.

sen.j: 天明の大火（天明8年）の後に田必器を訪ねて伊勢山田に遊歴。
sen.e: After the Great Fire of the Temmei period in 1788, he visited Denhitsuki and toured around Yamada, Ise Province.
After the Great Fire of the Temmei period in 1788, he visited Denhitsuki and toured around Yamada, Ise Province.
After the Great Fire of the Temmei period in 1788, he visited Denhitsuki and toured around Yamada, Ise Province.

sen.j: このとき24歳の小俣蠖庵に篆刻を伝えた。
sen.e: He taught seal engraving to Kakuan OMATA who was at the age of 24 then.
He taught seal engraving to Kakuan OMATA who was at the age of 24 then.
He taught seal engraving to Kakuan OMATA who was at the age of 24 then.
